main event: On May 13, 1955, a UFO sighting was reported on Bear Island, Maine. The object was described as a white, round, glowing object flying at a high altitude for approximately 3-5 minutes.
interesting points: The UFO sighting was reported by Leander Wilcox, a witness in Bear Island, Maine.
The object shot vapor trails before an explosion and was observed to have no particular shape, and was silver in color.
The report includes handwritten notes requesting an investigation by the Air Technical Intelligence Center to determine the source and identity of the observed object.
The conclusion of the sighting was uncertain, with possibilities of it being a balloon, astronomical object, or V.C. Flaro, with insufficient data for evaluation.
Two interceptors were scrambled from the 49th FIS at 17:35 on May 13, 1955, but did not sight anything.
